headline: Scientists home in on alternatives to ‘forever chemicals’
context: These chemicals' link to harmful health problems is fueling a search for other options

Some water-resistant fabrics, including those used in umbrellas, contain persistent “forever chemicals,” or PFAS. A new review article outlines principles to design PFAS alternatives without their longest-lasting chemical bonds.
